Description: To resolve a Clean Air Act case, Alcoa agreed to spend $330 million to reduce emissions, pay a $1.5 million civil penalty and spend $2.5 million on supplementary environmental projects.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2003/April/03_enrd_215.htm
https://www.sec.gov/News/PressRelease/Detail/PressRelease/1370540596936

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 331315: Aluminum Sheet, Plate, and Foil Manufacturing
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Alcoa World Alumina LLC, a majority-owned and controlled global alumina sales company of Alcoa Inc., agreed to plead guilty and pay $223 million in criminal fines and forfeiture to resolve charges that it paid millions of dollars in bribes through an international middleman in London to officials of the Kingdom of Bahrain, in violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/alcoa-world-alumina-agrees-plead-guilty-foreign-bribery-and-pay-223-million-fines-and

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 331315: Aluminum Sheet, Plate, and Foil Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2002 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.
